failure.message:
`cy.request()` failed on:
https://conduit.productionready.io/api/articles/
The response we received from your web server was:
> 422: Unprocessable Entity
This was considered a failure because the status code was not `2xx` or `3xx`.
If you do not want status codes to cause failures pass the option: `failOnStatusCode: false`
-----------------------------------------------------------
The request we sent was:
Method: POST URL: https://conduit.productionready.io/api/articles/ Headers: { "Connection": "keep-alive", "Authorization": "Token eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJlbWFpbCI6ImFydGVtLmJvbmRhcjE2QGdtYWlsLmNvbSIsInVzZXJuYW1lIjoiYXJ0ZW0iLCJpYXQiOjE2NjAzMDA5MjMsImV4cCI6MTY2NTQ4NDkyM30.CaXtoGP5vKizveQWj9yxYLQI_9MpHFQiSGQwax9WW8Q", "user-agent": "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:103.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/103.0", "accept": "*/*", "accept-encoding": "gzip, deflate", "content-type": "application/json", "content-length": 115, "referer": "https://conduit.productionready.io/api/articles/" } Body: {"article":{"tagList":[],"title":"Request from APIs","description":"API testing is easy","body":"Angular is cool"}} Redirects: [ "307: https://api.realworld.io/api/articles/" ]
-----------------------------------------------------------
The response we got was:
